column4: Ubuntu /Grub question: With  10.04.1 due - Would a dual installation of 10.04 & 10.04.1 be ok on same disk - could GRUB differentiate ok?
grub2 sees and adds entries for all the os's it finds for me. if i pluyg in a flash drive with 10.04 on it.. it will add it to the grub menus. :) (which can be annoying, or good)
apps are normally installed system wide..
'title bar' vanishing i is proberly compiz crashing
Any ideas re the funny Nautilus behaviour... happens here on desktop & on netbook. Both since kernel update only
no idea on that..  as for fscking the drive.  theres commands to make it fsck them at the next reboot.
cheeres & many thanks (copies command and gets ready to reboot ;-D
restart compiz..  or install the fusion-icon tool and it can handle compiz crashing.
next time it does it try alt-f2 and 'compiz --replace'
sounds like compiz crashign to me.
LTS is more of a concern to businesses and so forth worried about security.
i imagine any security issues will get updated in une also since the repos are the same.
thanks - that was also the supposition I was working on.

[reason for my question was... I have convinced sister to switch to UNE on her netbook & had recommended she let me put Lynx UNE on it to replace dead system she has atm... my ears were getting worried  re the pan when she found UNE died earlier than I  promised].  Thanks again - my ears feel safer already ;)
